maml:description.maml:para: Adds a OneNote XML Schema element as a child of another
Adds an already created OneNote XML Schema element as a child of another - using the XML DOM AppendChild method. Note that no explicit checking of validity of the resulting XML is undertaken.

maml:Description.maml:para: The OneNote Schema element to add.
The parent object in the OneNote hierarchy to which the new element will be added as a child.
The OneNote Schema element to add.
The parent object in the OneNote hierarchy to which the new element will be added as a child.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $myPage = Get-ONPage -Page 'Amazon.co.uk - Stuart' $myOutline = New-ONElement -Element "Outline" -Document $myPage $myOEChildren = New-ONElement -Element "OEChildren" -Document $myPage $myOE = New-ONElement -Element "OE" -Document $myPage $myT = New-ONElement -Element "T" -Document $myPage $myT.InnerText = "Hello There yyyxxxxxyyy !" Add-ONElement -Element $myT -Parent $myOE Add-ONElement -Element $myOE -Parent $myOEChildren Add-ONElement -Element $myOEChildren -Parent $myOutline Add-ONElement -Element $myOutLine -Parent $myPage

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the current OneNote Hierarchy
Loads the current OneNote Hierarchy for use by other functions. Use this command to ensure you are working with the current XML structure.
Gets one or more OneNote Notebooks.
Returns one or more OneNote XML Schema based elements representing specific Notebooks.

maml:Description.maml:para: Notebook Id?
The NoteBook name to query. Just one.
Notebook Id?
The NoteBook name to query. Just one.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets OneNote Notebooks
Returns OneNote XML Schema based elements representing Notebooks
Gets a OneNote Page.
Returns OneNote XML Schema based element representing a specific Page. Ignores pages in the recycle bin.

maml:Description.maml:para: Page Id?
What Page?
Page Id?
What Page?

maml:description.maml:para: Any object with a Page or Name property.
Extended by the currently selected OneNote schema. This includes the full content of the page, unlike the objects returned by the Get-ONPages command.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function uses the XPath SelectSingleNode method 'under the hood'. This means: In the event of multiple pages having the same name, only the first will be returned. The page search is case-sensitive.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns a Page XmlElement object representing the page with the exact name "My Page".
This example uses the Get-ONPages command and standard PowerShell filtering to pass objects to Get-ONPage via the pipeline. Get-ONPage then returns a Page XmlElement object for each object received.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-Service | Where-Object { $_.Name -like '*winrm*' } | Get-ONPage
one : http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/onenote/2013/onenote ID : {D7B35AD3-1559-0CBB-0F63-F10786864060}{1}{E19476877483600779377920100891604390372276781} name : WinRM dateTime : 2016-06-25T14:28:56.000Z lastModifiedTime : 2016-06-25T14:30:28.000Z pageLevel : 1 lang : en-GB QuickStyleDef : {PageTitle, p} PageSettings : PageSettings Title : Title Outline : Outline

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns a Page XmlElement that whose name matches that of the object passed down the pipeline.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-ONPage -id '{AB5DB915-FB77-0D89-1B94-8D316660CFCB}{1}{E1910021276453986493171911072997640903877411}'
one : http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/onenote/2013/onenote ID : {AB5DB915-FB77-0D89-1B94-8D316660CFCB}{1}{E1910021276453986493171911072997640903877411} name : Article list dateTime : 2017-04-15T11:41:36.000Z lastModifiedTime : 2017-08-24T13:00:13.000Z pageLevel : 1 lang : en-GB QuickStyleDef : {PageTitle, p} PageSettings : PageSettings Title : Title Outline : Outline

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns a page based on its ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets OneNote Pages

Returns OneNote XML Schema based elements representing Pages. By default, all Pages from all Notebooks are returned and can be filtered using standard cmdlets like Where-Object. As an alternative you can specify the names or IDs of the Notebook or Section hosting the Pages.

maml:Description.maml:para: The ID of the Notebook hosting the pages.
The name of the Notebook hosting the pages.
The ID of the Section hosting the pages.
The name of the Section hosting the pages.
The ID of the Notebook hosting the pages.
The name of the Notebook hosting the pages.
The ID of the Section hosting the pages.
The name of the Section hosting the pages.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more OneNote Sections
Returns OneNote XML Schema based elements representing one or more Sections.

maml:Description.maml:para: Section Id?
The Section name to query. Just one.
Section Id?
The Section name to query. Just one.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns the two Sections specified by name.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-ONSection -Id '{70863F49-36D4-0CB0-1CBD-AF8C35E05883}{29}{B0}'
name : Lesson Plans ID : {70863F49-36D4-0CB0-1CBD-AF8C35E05883}{29}{B0} path : https://d.docs.live.net/816f7725bef99999/Documents/Real World Samples/Lesson Plans.one lastModifiedTime : 2020-03-25T19:31:49.000Z color : #D5A4BB Page : {3rd Grade Math, Egyptian numbers - Handout #2, Number System in China - Handout #8, Trace the Graph...}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns the Section specified by the Id.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets OneNote Section Groups.
Returns OneNote XML Schema based elements representing Section Groups.

maml:Description.maml:para: The ID of the Notebook containing the Section Groups.
The name of the Notebook containg the Section Groups.
The ID of the Notebook containing the Section Groups.
The name of the Notebook containg the Section Groups.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns all Section Groups in all Notebooks.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-ONSectionGroups -NoteBookName 'WebNotes'
name : First Section Group ID : {1F3C5AB9-BEDB-49AE-8FFE-C0EEB19817D5}{1}{B0} path : https://d.docs.live.net/816f7725bef99999/WebNotes/First Section Group/ lastModifiedTime : 2020-03-28T11:44:42.000Z Section : Section

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns all Section Groups in the specified Notebook

maml:description.maml:para: Gets OneNote Sections

Returns OneNote XML Schema based elements representing Sections. By default, all Sections from all Notebooks are returned and can be filtered using standard cmdlets like Where-Object. As an alternative you can specify the names or IDs of the Notebook hosting the Sections.

maml:Description.maml:para: The ID of the Notebook hosting the Sections.
The name of the Notebook hosting the Sections.
The ID of the Notebook hosting the Sections.
The name of the Notebook hosting the Sections.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns all Sections in all Notebooks

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns all of the sections from the named Notebook.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a OneNote XML Schema based element
Creates an element of the specified type in the specified XML document's DOM using the currently in-use schema.

maml:Description.maml:para: The tag name of the new element.
The XML Document object (OneNote Page) to host the new element.
The XML Document object (OneNote Page) to host the new element.
The tag name of the new element.

dev:remarks.maml:para: $myOutline = New-ONElement -Element "Outline" -Document $myPage $myOEChildren = New-ONElement -Element "OEChildren" -Document $myPage $myOE = New-ONElement -Element "OE" -Document $myPage $myT = New-ONElement -Element "T" -Document $myPage $myT.InnerText = "Hello There yyyxxxxxyyy !" Add-ONElement -Element $myT -Parent $myOE Add-ONElement -Element $myOE -Parent $myOEChildren Add-ONElement -Element $myOEChildren -Parent $myOutline Add-ONElement -Element $myOutLine -Parent $myPage Update-ONPage $myPage.OuterXML

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new OneNote Page.
Returns a OneNote XML Schema based element representing the new page.

maml:Description.maml:para: The ID of the Section in which the Page is to be created.
The ID of the Section in which the Page is to be created.

dev:type.maml:name: System.Xml.XmlElement extended by the currently selected OneNote schema.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example uses the Get-ONSections command and standard PowerShell filtering to pass objects to New-ONPage via the pipeline. New-ONPage then returns a Page XmlElement object for each object received.

maml:description.maml:para: Publishes a OneNote page in an external file format.
Publishes a OneNote page. Available formats are:
- MHTML files (.mht) - (OneNote 2013 or newer)
- Adobe Acrobat PDF files (.pdf)
- XML Paper Specification (XPS) files (.xps)
- OneNote Package files (.onepkg)
- Microsoft Word documents (.doc or .docx)
- Microsoft Windows Enhanced Metafiles (.emf)
- HTML files (.html)

maml:Description.maml:para: The Id of the OneNote page to be published.
One of the valid publishing file formats.
The full path of the file to be created.
One of the valid publishing file formats.
The Id of the OneNote page to be published.
The full path of the file to be created.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates a PDF version of the specified page at the specified location.

maml:description.maml:para: Displays a page in the OneNote user interface.
Displays a page in the OneNote user interface.

maml:Description.maml:para: Page Id?
Displays the Page in a new OneNote window, instead of re-using an existing window if one exists.
Page Name?
Displays the Page in a new OneNote window, instead of re-using an existing window if one exists.
Page Id?
Page Name?
Displays the Page in a new OneNote window, instead of re-using an existing window if one exists.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command displays the specified page in OneNote.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts the OneNote application if it is not already running.
Starts the OneNote application if it is not already running. Returns a COM object for further use by the module.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example starts the OneNote application.

maml:description.maml:para: Unloads the COM Object
Unloads the COM Object
Updates an existing OneNote page
Updates a OneNote page using the currently in-use schema.

maml:Description.maml:para: An xml string containing the updated page content
An xml string containing the updated page content
